cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 170 mi SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting north, forecast to bend northwest and come ashore near the South Carolina coast this weekend, then move slowly northward along/near the U.S. East Coast before turning east-northeast and moving back offshore near the Mid-Atlantic/New England coast early next week.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach, SC to Cape Lookout, NC under Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coast from Georgia through the Carolinas, then northward into the Mid-Atlantic and New England during the 5-day period
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of experiencing tropical-storm-force gusts late Monday–Tuesday; otherwise breezy conditions possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for New York & New Jersey harbors based on current track and intensity.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain possible early next week with amounts generally 1–2 inches or less.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Enhanced rip currents and rough surf along Atlantic beaches as swells reach the region.
